description: From Latin appetibilis, from appetere: compare French appétible.

adjectives.description: appetible (comparative more appetible, superlative most appetible)

entries.meaning: Desirable; capable or worthy of being the object of desire.
examples: my answer doth sufficiently prove that which I intend ; that the rational will hath power , both to slight the most appetible objects, and to control the most unruly passions.
